intro: Malvastrum orbiculatum, commonly known as the common mallow, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and wastelands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like hibiscus and cotton. Malvastrum orbiculatum is often considered an invasive species in some regions due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
